Lobbyist Name: Childcare Community Business Clg.  T/A Treasure Tots Nursery
Specific Details: We are a community based nursery in a disadvantaged area and rely on CE participants engaged in childcare training to staff the nursery.  The new Pre school regulation re mandatory FETAC level 5 qualification for adults who work directly with the children will have a disastrous impact on our nursery. We rely on CE participants to make up the adult child ratios and if we no longer can count them in we need to employ fully qualified staff to comply with this new regulation.
DPOs Lobbied: Joan Collins|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Catherine Byrne|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Aengus Ó Snodaigh|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Katherine Zappone|Minister|Department of Children and Youth Affairs
Subject Matter: We are a community based nursery in a disadvantaged area and rely on CE participants engaged in childcare training to staff the nursery.  The new Pre school regulation re mandatory FETAC level 5 qualification for adults who work directly with the children will have a disastrous impact on our nursery. We rely on CE participants to make up the adult child ratios and if we no longer can count them in we need to employ fully qualified staff to comply with this new regulation.
Intended Results: We are not sustainable and cannot generate more income to employ fully trained staff to comply with this regulation. We need  additional support funding to employ the additional qualified staff to comply with the new regulation.  Otherwise we will close with the loss of 60 childcare places and 26 staff which would be huge blow to a RAPID area with a number of DEIS schools.  We cannot increase our fees so we need additional support funding for additional staff to keep the nursery open.
Lobbying Activities:
Called to various politicians local office or clinics in this area|Meeting|2-5::Subsequent to the meetings communicated with the various local politicians by email|Email|2-5::Letter to Minister Zappone replying to the letter the minister wrote to Catherine Byrne about our current position around the new Pre School regulation and CE participants in training exclusion from adult child ratios
Sent letter by email|Letter|1

Specific Details: On the 26th of July, Eoghan O'Finn, representative for Aengus O Snodaigh, contacted Youth Theatre Ireland for input into Sinn Féin's Arts Policy. We responded that we would be happy to meet with Anegus to discuss. The online meeting took place on the 21st of August 2024.

Subject Matter: On the 26th of July, Eoghan O'Finn, representative for Aengus O Snodaigh, contacted Youth Theatre Ireland for input into Sinn Féin's Arts Policy. We responded that we would be happy to meet with Anegus to discuss. The online meeting took place on the 21st of August 2024.
Intended Results: The meeting was requested by Aengus and we intended to use the meeting to respond to the proposed policy and to discuss the needs of Youth Theatre Ireland, our members and the wider youth arts and youth work network.
Lobbying Activities: Following a number of emails to firm up a date for meeting and re-arranging a date, one virtual meeting took place on the 21st of August. |Virtual Meeting|1

Specific Details: On 10 September, Helium Arts took part in Dail Ealaion, The assembly was convened by Aengus O Snodaigh, TD. The purpose of the assembly was to bring together key voices within the arts to assist in a more comprehensive policy for the arts for Sinn Féin's electoral manifesto.

Subject Matter: On 10 September, Helium Arts took part in Dail Ealaion, The assembly was convened by Aengus O Snodaigh, TD. The purpose of the assembly was to bring together key voices within the arts to assist in a more comprehensive policy for the arts for Sinn Féin's electoral manifesto.
Intended Results: We sought to  to brief Sinn Fein & seek pledge of support from the party and to secure a commitment in Sinn Féin's electoral manifesto for continued funding to consolidate/expand our services to children w/lifelong health conditions & any potential programme for Gov they may be negotiating. The impact of our work on children/families wellbeing is independently proven.We sought support for principle of our work, as part of a holistic approach for children w/illness.
Lobbying Activities: Took place in The Complex, 12 Mary's Abbey, D7|Event / Reception|1
